subject: Climate & Environment
title: Upwelling: Cold Water, Rich Life
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Upwelling: Cold Water, Rich Life.

hook.text: The richest fishing grounds on Earth sit where cold, deep water rises to the surface.

buildup.text: Wind pushes surface water away from coastlines. Cold, nutrient-rich water rises to replace it.

discovery.text: These nutrients feed phytoplankton blooms that support entire marine food webs.

twist.text: Peru's anchovy fishery â€” the world's largest â€” depends entirely on Pacific upwelling.

climax.text: Climate change may alter wind patterns, disrupting upwelling zones and the fisheries they support.

punchline.text: The ocean's richest waters come from its deepest, coldest places.

quiz.question: What causes coastal upwelling?
options: Wind pushes surface water away and deep water rises
Warm water sinks and cold water rises
